channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: In case you were wondering how the Trumpist Republican establishment was handling today's testimony.... https://t.co/A7zq9zZs1R
This looks cool. https://t.co/x7dYnVD5nJ
@OboistaAlli @BudaZsofia @DavidRSelis @TheJohnRylands Here’s the correct link: https://t.co/x7dYnVD5nJ
@Atrios Which makes the editor’s malfeasance more egregious.

@rmneiss Ah, but can you afford to offend the local politicians? We are no longer in “free to be you and me” territory. The Confederacy is now closer to Leo Frank than to Morris Abram — whose Supreme Court victory is what launchef Alito on his half century reactionary crusade.
@jamesdnicoll I guess the feds didn’t like them using the Tor network.

This review makes a compelling case that the novel at hand is not as interesting as its author’s Wikipedia page. Though that’s a very high bar. https://t.co/x7jVzfVAQw
Certainly Bob Dylan thought enough of Bernard Wolfe’s writing to borrow passages for his memoir, Chronicles. https://t.co/JyIQ0WDmYE
Anyway, read the Wikipedia entry and marvel. https://t.co/cNgp8cvAiH
Note that the Tikvah Fund-aligned Kohelet Forum is taking the side of the haredi rabbis on this issue. https://t.co/UCMUIZBSOG
@Foone @sebmal @suddendesu Not going to stand for this VisiCalc erasure.
@BradDittner @emptywheel I think it’s a search for potentially relevant emails, which are then passed to the special master to review for actual relevance.
@typolad Hoping not in a covid sense.
Dig it! https://t.co/HaNBUAThjk

@jholbo1 The problem is that Alito explicitly wants to bring back the rotten borough system used to uphold Jim Crow before being banned under the one man one vote rulings of the mid 60s.
@jholbo1 Basically, he thinks any ruling issued after Dylan turned the Beatles on to marijuana is fruit of the demon weed.
@jewishmemequeen @GanzAvi @Dovid Also on ancient times: A dime was respectable earnings.
Wow. https://t.co/35gBc4H1FB

TFW your translator misses the key pun your whole piece is leading up to: Namely, between Charedim -- literally, those who fear -- and, I'm guessing, the Machredim, those who cause fear. Or those who terrorize. https://t.co/VcegSraZUl
In other words, you don't have to be haredi to fear the post-haredi era.
@typolad If you had been told that God died for *your* sins, you'd feel pretty special too.
@HeerJeet Should have a content warning for those still traumatized by the video of the Staten Island Shoprite assault, however.

@datadivajf Odd. Don't we hold like Annie, who taught us "The sun will come out tomorrow?" And didn't we learn from Alice, ‘jam tomorrow and jam yesterday – but never jam today.’? Don't read 'jam,' but rather sun.

This: "The anti-gay, anti-abortion, anti-trans Nazi rhetoric felt so fucking familiar to 2022." https://t.co/SfDY9P9Lfo
Or to put it differently: The Christianists of the Republican Party don't believe that we should be, as the song has it, "free to be you and me."
That generally true of their allies, too.

Today in useful Wikipedia pages that would benefit from an hour's editorial investment by a person knowledgeable on the topic. https://t.co/oNbePhX90S
To take one example, it mentions only one of the two New York State get laws.

Reminder: Religious fanatics like the current RogueSCOTUS don’t believe in policy since everything important was allegedly spoken by God back in the day. https://t.co/8Cno3xUUst
Worth noting that the Talmud very much did believe in policy, and that this week’s pending gutting of the EPA will be at direct odds with Talmudic principles of justice every yeshiva high school student knows.
@adamtroycastro @scalzi But the tusks!
@EladNehorai Now do IUDs.
